meanings.definition: Unable to move or be moved.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rock was immobile on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The tree seemed immobile in the calm breeze.
meanings.sent3: The immobile chair refused to slide across the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her fear made her feel as immobile as a statue.
meanings.sent5: The old car, rusted and immobile, sat in the garage for years.

meanings.definition: Not capable of moving or being moved.
meanings.sent1: The frozen lake was immobile under the winter sun.
meanings.sent2: The massive boulder was immobile despite the earthquake.
meanings.sent3: The immobile robot malfunctioned and stood still in the lab.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness made him as immobile as a stubborn mule.
meanings.sent5: The ancient statue stood immobile in the museum, frozen in time.
